name: Core components and terms
description: Key APIM concepts you will use throughout the wizard.

terms.definition: The runtime component that receives requests, applies policies, and forwards to backends.
Configuration surface (portal, ARM, APIs) for APIs, products, policies, users, and diagnostics.
API consumer experience for discovering APIs, requesting access, and getting keys/tokens.
A set of operations (paths/methods). APIs can be imported (OpenAPI) or created manually.
A packaging unit that bundles APIs and defines access rules (subscriptions, approval, visibility).
A consumer access entity that typically issues subscription keys and controls quotas/rate limits.
Key/value configuration used in policies (often backed by Key Vault).
XML-based traffic policy executed in inbound/outbound/on-error sections.

nextSteps: Map your API consumers to products and subscriptions.
Identify which concerns are best implemented with policies (auth, routing, rate limiting, logging).
